EVLUVk1MN7eaqoV7lYayaQ.text: Here today and the rude girl with glasses taking my order did Nothing but rush me and I was going to order more food to take home for my kids,,  their loss. I will stop someplace else.

9lrAS8cPsIURZdiBHvWeUA.text: This place has some tasty BBQ sandwiches.  In the last month I have had the Pulled Pork, Chicken, and Brisket sandwiches and they are tasty and filling.  The house BBQ sauce is excellent!  If you get a sandwich and drink it will end up costing around $13-$14 which is on the high end of BBQ lunches but the saving grace is that they do have the punch card deal where the fifth sandwich is free.  It turns lunch into a quest!

AGYHpPM0eex57zvHOMFvBA.text: Honestly, i prefer sweet bbq. I am by no means saying the food is bad. It's good but my experience woukd be better if the sauce was sweeter.  I think its pretty expensive too. I got pulled brisket with two sides, a drink and a dessert and it was almost 25 dollars.   I would probably come back but there are other options that are cheaper and has the type of sauce i like.

UcZsNSpwOkgCn6Z4iLitLA.text: The food at Bell's barbecue is always mouth watering good. I took my friend here for breakfast. She loved the chicken and waffles. It was the seasoning of the chicken  that makes it so tasty. My husband's favorite is the pulled pork sandwiches.  I love their biscuits and gravy. True southern style. This place is great for dine in or take out.

photos.caption: Photo of Bell's BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States

fcD03vAUB6wBGSbOidZKrg.text: Great customer service! Greeted with a smile and a welcome rather than someone just asking "what do you want"  the girls looked like they actually enjoy being at their job. I also loved the scenery of the restaurant and the cleanliness!!  I will definitely be back soon

q4Gle4lu24P9fYwRJSe-rw.text: We just came here for the first time and this is our favorite bbq restaurant west of the Mississippi. The food was excellent. The service was great. We had the pulled pork sandwiches. They were so good on Texas toast. The sides were great. The baked beans are full of pulled pork. The 4 cheese corn lives up to the hype. It was nummy. The Brussels sprouts were interesting. The mac and cheese was very cheesy. The yams were delicious. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone they wants great bbq with yummy sides.

QbInbfrwbGup1w4doQ-BxQ.text: First visit. Everyone was SO nice and helpful!  Loved the baby backs!!!!!  I know some don't like "fall off the bone", but I do. They were perfection for me. Original sauce is to dye for.  Got brisket for hubby (I don't care for brisket), he loved. Sweet potatoes we good, just different, I'd get again.

_ZjdquEvRa0jXjODNGOYLg.text: First time here today. Great pulled pork sandwich and cheesy grits. Food very good and prices reasonable and quick friendly service. I will definitely be back

XdUmaTgzgDCj9wUtPDszGg.text: Ribs were very meaty (much much meatier than Tony Roma's). Baked beans and okra fries rocked. Just maybe need more sauce options ala Famous Daves. Staff was exceptional. Highly recommended.

2t2I3l-n04IBqqsvKZ8eFQ.text: Since moving to Henderson, this is by far the best BBQ place we've found. The food is amazing and I highly recommend the Buffalo Fried Cauliflower and Cornbread Waffle.  The desserts come in a glass mason jar that you can return for entry into a raffle. Caramelized Banana Pudding and Creme Brulee? Come on!! Staff is personable and efficient. What's not to love?  Get on down there. We'll certainly be back soon.

-aeUkEHXp4vbVzVUWfwoAA.text: Great looking place, nice menu but the food is not good. The pork belly was not good because of the funky tasting sauce, the brisket was also smothered with a sauce that was overpowering. The cheesy grits were bland and the sweet potatoes were terrible. The only thing I liked was the crispy Brussels sprouts which I had never seen before. We won't be going back.

tC-CM6FpjwfN1GkuROfZNw.text: The thing we look for the most is customer service and this place has it! Then it was on to how is the BBQ. Everyone says they have great! BBQ.... Well this place has that too! It's exciting to have a great family owned establishment down the street with great food. Congrats to the owners and to the Employees for doing a great job. Let's keep great businesses like this flowing in our Area..

KB1k3vg6GLNBW9KcJB6SNg.text: Delicious Bbq! Great place to grab and go or sit in! We had pulled pork sandwiches, brisket sandwiches and even tried a shrimp po boy.. All were seasoned just right and really yummy. Staff were super helpful and friendly. Homemade pickles were awesome- just wish there were more than three in my box . Need to get a whole jar for the fam I guess. Haven't tried the desserts yet- stuffed from the meal, but the menu is so tempting!! We will definitely be back!!

GP--f1M9NeW4Z9BwiorUnw.text: It was OK.... Had much better and had worse.  Service was kinda slow but they did come around many times while eating to make sure we were doing ok.

WlZyeIn4zWpaNMzy1MehNw.text: Amazing barbecue place. The place itself is well-decorated, the employees are all nice, and the food is amazing. They have great barbecue sauces too. I recommend the pulled pork sandwich with a side of beans. Also, very close and convenient.

4gmE9ncGG5vzmd91sDmG6A.text: Decided to  try bells BBQ tonight  for the first time  and I have to  say  the last. The meat  was dry and the sides  were cold. They were out of  items  and in my opinion  is way over  priced

CWqFbLxxp7f8wOgrr5E8kA.text: I don't usually take the time to leave reviews but this place was amazing! Not only was the food amazing but honestly the staff was what I loved the most. Super friendly staff!! Very attentive!!! They would come over and ask how the food was and even asked if they could refill our drinks for us!! WOW!! Just an overall great place!!

Ae-Lpl4PQT7v9bCkJz16NA.text: This place is phenomenal. Great customer service and the food was full of so much flavor. My only regret is not trying a sweet jar. I will eat here every time I'm in Nevada!!

dInVtmX7pF8yjI6Cb2Kvag.text: So they were out of ribs and brisket and the prices were bit high for the plates. Then there was the 30 minute wait where I watched another family of 3 who ordered after us were served before us. The food was ok but nothing spectacular and the chicken was dry. Guess we caught them at a bad time because even the servers looked confused as to what they were doing.

Rnuku0RjyEKnYZYdRG1Ikw.text: This is a great place for BBQ & some great southern food! Fried green tomatoes are awesome! Great customer service! A must try!

SgoXkIVfeYScsbmFaI9oTw.text: The pork sandwich was more fat then anything else. Half of it was inedible. The macaroni and cheese was soupy and watered down. Got a side salad with old dried out cucumbers and balsamic dressing with no flavor. Once again an inedible item. Not to mention they were out of some of the sides i really wanted.  Unfortunately i didn't have the same experience as other yelpers and wont be coming back here.

P9ITXHhNkkSfbodA6iLqVA.text: Both my fiance and I had sandwiches there and was very disappointed. Maybe our expectations were too high but I didn't even finish my food (which if you know me its unheard of!)

3QcekHYR1y_G4770Twj1Lw.text: Great food, decent prices, ill be going back. Sides were great, main course was great. We ordered a large order to feed 5 and it turned out to be more than we could handle, great portion sizes.

sQFu0LJve2JO5sOzh4E38Q.text: Best BBQ in Vegas!  I asked the hubby to bring some pulled pork home for me... But he surprised me with chicken and waffles.  I'm kinda in a chicken and waffles love affair lately and these are the best I've tasted by a long shot!  The BBQ sauce was very good but the flavors of the meat were so tasty I hardly used much of it!  I loved the baked beans--they are a variety of beans & not just the same 'ol jazzed up jar of Bush's like some other places I've been. The desserts were really impressive. They are served in a glass mason jar (even if you get it to-go) and were as tasty as they are beautiful. I might have to take my jar back for a refill!

yUO4mALLFscIIEouWdtCYA.text: Been to Bell's BBQ twice now, both were good experiences. The meats, I have had the pulled pork, sliced brisket and pork belly. The pulled pork is good, not the greatest that I have eaten but still very tasty. The brisket is great, both times that I have been here I get it and it has yet to disappoint. Pork belly was phenomenal, I could have chowed down 10 pounds of it!! The staff is friendly and courteous, the food comes out quickly as well.

8tp2aF7qu2QepNJUdyol4g.text: It was ok would come back if in area, ran out of Brisket...how does a BBQ place not know they are running short especially close to dinner time. Had the Catfish and St. Louis ribs definitely can tell its not BBQd on an open grill but an indoor one...if ever in Mason or Llano Texas go to Coopers BBQ for what BBQ should taste like, but in a pinch this is the place to go so far that we have tried here in the Vegas area.

uRP7BSnHdpk8jJHx2LvAJA.text: Ordered delivery last night. Delivery arrived with 30 minutes. Food was warm and delicious. We ordered: Brisket, St Louis Ribs, Baby Back Ribs, greens, rice & beans, mac & cheese, brussel sprouts, fried okra, banana pudding, and creme brulee. ... everything was amazing. We will be ordering again!

7zAgHGWt99ZqWuNCmN5XIg.text: This place is Awesome... Balil was very nice and explained the menu very well.. I would definitely recommend this place to family and friends.

MDOWAsgjRTihQ_yhD9DuAg.text: So I ordered baby back ribs with cheesy grits and "smashed" potatoes. My husband got brisket with potato salad and "Hot Tots" which describes them as hot links with ketchup. I prefer my ribs dry because if it's done right you don't need sauces to make it moist, flavorful, and tender. First the "smashed" potatoes were garlic mashed potatoes and not "smashed". Chef needs to know difference. Grits were extremely dense, but good. Brisket and ribs no real flavor until I added salt or when BBQ sauce added. It's all about the meat when it comes to BBQ, not just sauce. Tender enough for me with ribs, but boring flavor. Brisket tender enough, but very boring in flavor.  Back to "hot Tots". Describes them as hot links, but they were tator Tots with a little bit of sausage. Not described properly. Been there several times for breakfast and always great. The cornbread offered is.             awesome. Offer all the time. You should offer breakfast all the time because that seems to be the successful menu. Actually threw away almost half our meal after spending a lot of money  because nothing was worth saving. Everything was pretty boring. I did not originally give this place 3 star, but it was changed from 2to3 after posted

R9S3seDcQgzDb3gWOSdUUQ.text: Food is always on point. Standouts are the catfish, ribs and brisket.   My only complaintsis small- they bring the food out one meal at a time so you're sitting there with your food getting cold while everyone else waits for there's.

8hIDlITsQSJpsRhGhIwy9w.text: Just ok and not authentic BBQ. Mac and cheese is dry, I don't believe they have a smoker so I think they are using dry heat. They store the food in crescores. Service is awful, sauce is passable but not great. They are alway out of food. Not sure if I would go back, maybe give it another try but I felt let down on this one. Much better BBQ other places.

ZGbpPl1P01Jv_Vdb_VltKQ.text: I am in love with this place. Balil helped us and suggested the pulled chicken... IT WAS DELICIOUS!!! THANK YOU GUYS. We'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Bell's BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. PERFECTION!!!!

4TmqVduE6MlE8wOt8c5a2g.text: Just bought St Louis ribs, pork belly and brisket a few minutes ago.  The cashier, Ashley M, based on the receipt, a young lady with red hair was having a bad day I guess because she was rude and did not even try to smile.  You work in food service you should have tried to fake a smile.  We live close by but will go back this restaurant ever again.  My son corrected me.  Her hair was red.  But the food was good.

Gh0-3Gdh8wKWCWGvsgxsyQ.text: This was a very disappointing food experience. The food was bland, under seasoned, and lacked any real uniqueness. The macaroni was dry and tasted of cornstarch, the cheese grits didn't have enough liquid so it became a solid block with no flavor, the brisket was dry (hence the need for so much bbq sauce), the fried okra was too salty, and the St. Louis ribs were cooked in a flavorless rub. The best parts of the meal were the mashed yams, bbq sauce itself, Devyns pickles, pulled pork, and the fluffer nutter dessert. That's very unfortunate because I was excited for a new bbq atmosphere besides the food chain of famous Dave's, but I know I won't be back.

pgjPOvufxHvKBUiiFp7dAw.text: I was disappointed in the food. The two different ribs tasted exactly the same to me. Coleslaw was rather tasteless. The BBQ sauce was so thin, I think they watered it down. The dill pickles were good. Cashier not overly friendly. It was 5pm and only one family ahead of us. By the time we left the line was out the door and she seemed pretty rattled. The price, too expensive ($42.00) for two meals. I might expect this in a normal restaurant with a waitress. This place you order like at McDonald's and then the meal is brought to you.

hNsVi41aUh6UoIkwUXyEfg.text: This is a cute little place and the service was awesome. The food was great. My favorite was the pumpkin tres leeches dessert. The fries are cool they are all mixed together with a variety. I will come back.

ewFfkUYPtuCiyH268hhhUg.text: Employee's customer service is top notch, they make you feel so welcomed every time. The decor is great. Now let's get to the amazing food. I've had several items so far and nothing seems to disappoint. The bbq sauce has the right amount of spice and the right amount of sweetness. The brisket sandwich is between Texas toast and is so tender and delicious. The amount of sides to choose from is incredible. The three cheese corn is my personal favorite. The prices are very nice as well with the amount of food you receive. The sweet jars for dessert are so tasty and I love that you can return your jars for a raffle. When you go into there, you can see the experience the chef has under his belt, definitely worth trying.

Zk7p_6DrKAfCjVoGEBTbGQ.text: Amazing amazing food! The dessert was definitely homemade. Can't wait to come back again and the staff was really helpful about answering questions on the menu

W1uOkn-xaAvDwIq6y0R2Eg.text: We stopped here on the way home one night and ordered the brisket, baby back ribs and the catfish. Everything was delicious! Super tender meat, crispy fish, yummy sides (definitely recommend the green tomatoes) and the spicy BBQ sauce is spot on. And on the recommendation of the staff we got the banana pudding which is as cute as it is tasty. All around a great new local place - we'll definitely be back!

n47ysp6uQTUP_GjvTRno2w.text: Food was cold, and didn't taste very good. I had the baby back ribs. Below average at best. I'm sticking to rollin smoke BBQ

kZpCEp0zFW1-wE_p7_7h9g.text: Brisket is Great!! Even the grilled cheese is Good:) The Corn Coblet is a must to try!

R53hXLfPR04kdTJIf2EOWQ.text: Found this place through TripAdvisor and thought I would give it a try with my cousin one afternoon. Best decision ever. As we walked in, we were immediately greeted with friendly employees. Since it was our first time, the employees gave us multiple suggestions, as well as had me sample there newly added side of Buffalo Fried Cauliflower. It was delicious, so of course I had to get that as one of my sides. I had ordered the Pulled Pork which came with the choice of 2 sides, Texas toast, and pickles. I was also able to get one additional side for free through yelp. They have SEVERAL sides to choose from! However, I went with the Buffalo Fried Cauliflower, 4 Cheese Crusted Corn Coblet, and 3 Cheese Mac. The portions were very generous that I definitely had to ask for a togo box. The older lady who was serving us was VERY sweet! Continuously made sure that we were doing all right, filled our drinks, etc. The 4 Cheese Crusted Corn Coblet was really good, the outermost part was crusted with cheese and in the middle was melted cheese that was "stringy" with every bite I took. The 3 Cheese Mac is one of the best Mac and Cheese sides I have ever had! There is no way to describe the deliciousness, you just have to try it on your own. The Buffalo Fried Cauliflower came with multiple pieces of deep fried cauliflower with buffalo sauce inside and was served with your choice of ranch or bleu cheese. The Pulled Pork was served upon a piece of Texas Toast and with crispy onion strings on top. They don't marinate it in BBQ sauce or anything of that sort because there is an entire rack filled with different types of BBQ sauces that you can choose from. All of which are very tasty. Although I was stuffed to the max, I couldn't walk out without trying one of there desserts. I ordered the Creme Brulee which was served in a mason jar. It was rich and creamy, not too sweet, just perfect. Only downside was that I think the price for desserts are a little too high. It was about $6 for the portion they served. Overall, this place is amazing and I definitely will be going back to try out other options.

2eC9B7x3eubrw50hWivwfg.text: Food was amazing! The brisket tender, and with so much flavor. Restaurant is clean, and waitstaff professional.  Reminds of of a bbq spot in Austin texas.

vnmQaZDsW2agPp-oKA3QzQ.text: Worst service - waited 20 mins for a to go order... Epic Fail - over priced - and mediocre quality at best... I'm sure Belles will be out of biz soon

OSBJXmoJz6IfvCk_VTgx1Q.text: It was pretty delicious and the staff was so nice.  The brussel sprouts were fantastic.  My husband loved the beef ribs and my chopped brisket was flavorful. The smashed potatoes were only good not great, and the reason for four stars, not five.

WVwAvGQRBD02E1AD80GAKg.text: This place tasted great and has the sweetest staff. They are on point! Will be back for more in the near future.

zOOUbiPezbNjXmjetfx4Nw.text: Yum! I love a good BBQ! Tried this place for the first time tonight and it was very good. I ordered the brisket and it was very tender with great flavor. The brisket was really good, but the standout tonight was definitely the bbq sauce. The original has a really good flavor, but the spicy one was delicious with a kick. Excellent taste and spicy level was perfect.   I also really liked the Caesar slaw. Genius! The boyfriend ordered a side of the pork and said it was good. A happy boyfriend makes my life easier. The mashed potatoes were a little boring for my taste... but a little spicy bbq sauce fixed them right up.   The service was very friendly and helpful. Kudos to smiling staff - it really makes a place standout. I can't wait to try more options from the side menu and maybe check out a dessert jar. I also ordered a glass of wine to drink while I waited the takeout. Total bill was about $50, which is pretty good for quality BBQ

RNoyi8QFEzGvFuelyhzgsg.text: Amazing thick sliced cut with your fork 14 hour smoked brisket.... absolutely melt in your mouth pulled pork.... an amazing array of unique and delicious sides.... good beers..... very pleasant and friendly staff.... what more could you ask for??? Oh yeah and amazing mason jar deserts..... winner, winner, smoked chicken dinner!!!!

nRijiizEU2iiJcaMojxWQA.text: Let's just say I've consumed A LOT of bbq, and this place is....okay. I couldn't decide between 3 stars and 4 stars, but decided to go with 3 because I'm on the fence and couldn't get passed their fried okra.  So, to put the visit in a nutshell and cap the food: their meats are good. My brisket wasn't as hot as I'd have preferred in when served, but it happens. Their sauces are delicious, so I was happy.  What I was VERY disappointed in was their fried okra. The okra was mushy. Fried okra is not supposed to be super mushy. Sorry. Not good. I think part of it is the way they cut it like french fries rather than in rounds like most places do (including how my grandma used to make fried okra.)  Bell's leaves a little bit to be desired, but if you're in the area and have a hankering for some bbq, I wouldn't count this place out by any means.   Would I come back here? Probably.  Would I recommend this place to others? Absolutely, with the caveat of "do not order their fried okra." Lol.

tOBTEsepq3OG4VoI377gQA.text: Absolutely delicious food. It's a little on the pricy side, but you get what you pay for. The portions are hardy and filling. I always get it delivered when I'm crazing amazing bbq.

iIdLCm_Wmje65QzPGgxYhg.text: Best BBQ sauce I've ever had - not too sweet, not too thick, just the right tang.   Loved the Pork Belly on Texas Toast, with brussels sprouts, green beans simmered with bacon and onion.  Pork Belly great texture and perfect amount of smokiness. Absolutely a must-try.   So happy I found this new restaurant close to home!

XFT7mFKdbLWENc796ByoYg.text: Stopped by on a whim- had time to kill while the car was being detailed. Super friendly service upon entering, throughout our meal and until we left. Food is great, multiple variations of awesome BBQ sauce, even a gluten free option. The sides were amazing, and the portions are huge. It's pretty hard to find decent BBQ, most places are just crappy chains. Not to mention the entire establishment was insanely clean, bathrooms included. Believe me, that does not go unappreciated. Was happy to find one that broke the mold here in Vegas. Will definitely be coming back.

odnga5tT-mM2OQI0_dTndQ.text: It was a good experience and the staff was very friendly! I had their ribs, Mac n cheese, and BBQ beans. Their ribs were very good BUT the BQQ sauce wasn't the best, I think they should have more of a variety to the sauces. The mac n cheese was delicious! and the beans were a fail bc it tasted like chili rather than BBQ beans. I would probably go back but would change some things on my order .

qoreR8GR4UcgMubLcx2rwQ.text: As a SoCalian who loves Roscoes and after living in Missouri for 10 years, I missed this type of comfort food. I found the soul food sides of greens and Mac n cheese a nice change to anything on a Eastern. I had the chicken and waffles and it was a large serving, enough for 2 meals. The service was good as well as the food. Everyone in our house loved this place because it reminded them of the soul type food we enjoyed in Missouri.

s9RVbaSv2sanqYMF6z422Q.text: YUM!!!  Don't let this location deceive you.  This is some of the most delicious BBQ I've ever had. . .and you must try to cheesy corn.

2r6VBbOxnUlkSzFnzaphbw.text: The restaurant is fairly large, but surprisingly empty early on the Friday evening we visited though the waitstaff and cooks seemed busy.  We decided to share a full rack of ribs that included a choice of 2 sides with us choosing JB's coleslaw and smashed potatoes, but I added a third, Buffalo fried cauliflower.  The ribs arrived pre-sliced with a small quantity of BBQ sauce applied to each.  Had I known, I would have requested them served intact without sauce.  The ribs were hardly fall off the bone tender and the smoke/rub was only faint.  The sauce was not to our liking and we found the sides to be just okay so there is no compelling reason for us to return.

2Q7la9G3BjT0mZ3RvEuYPA.text: Just tried this little gem yesterday from a friend reference, WOW!! Grilled Brussel Sprouts, buffalo cauliflower, shrimp & grits, pulled pork.....oh my!! This is a MUST if you appreciate authentic Southern eats. Everything we are amongst the 7 of us was amazing. This little hide away is also family owned, my favorite kind of place! Go & enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Bell's BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States

84-JvGQACjgewnChNadssw.text: We are blessed to have many BBQ options available in Henderson.   Many are good.  Bell's is right up there at the top of the heap!  So what makes Bell's better than the others?  Yes, that have all the regular BBQ basics...ribs, chicken, pork, etc.  in addition, they offer items the others don't. House specialties, if you will...  Shrimp and Grits - Outstanding!  Beef Ribs - Best I have ever had anywhere!  Sweet Jars - Small desserts...just the right size. I would tell you my favorite, but I have eaten them all and haven't found one that isn't my favorite.   House-made pickles.  5 choices of house-made BBQ Sauce including a gluten free option if that is important to you.   No matter what you desire, they have you covered.   Worth the drive if you eat there or take home or have it delivered.  Yes we are blessed in Henderson.   Thank you Bell's!

3RsXm-UvsBmpskId2rJYFw.text: As far as BBQ goes, this is just ok. The guy at the register was clueless. The brisket was overcooked, the pulled pork was dry and the ribs were pretty good, albeit a bit salty. As a guy who's spent 30 years behind a grill and a smoker, I was left wanting. The BBQ beans were very tasty though. The Mac N Cheese was outstanding! Coleslaw was the worst I have ever had. Very inconsistent. A couple of good sides, but one goes to a BBQ restaurant for the meats. This place is surely better than Lucille's (awful!!) and a damn site worse than Rollin' Smoke, Big B's or The Roadkill Grill. Those are the best three in town, in that order. You should probably go to one of them instead.

QUpioEpQn3-euuINlFkpeA.text: This is a go to for us, we usually end up getting the pulled pork meals but everything we have tried is delicious! There are so many side options which makes changing it up easier

Dj5MkFaSAT6_N-xVVF09Lw.text: The staff are pleasant and attentive.  The food is so juicy, meaty and savory.  It is a great value for moderate price.  I think this has become our favorite place for BBQ.

NnGLXnoTE-iG3TWl8xQcnQ.text: we decided to give bell's a go and ordered take out - heres what we got:  * beef ribs * brisket * red beans n rice * bbq beans * potato salad * mac n cheese * cheese encrusted corn * fried pickles * buffalo cauliflower bites * creme brule * smores  the counter service wasnt the greatest and staff couldve been a little friendly, at least? the girl who packed our food didnt do a thorough check to make sure everything was there so our mac n cheese was missing when we got home :/ luckily, we called n got them to deliver it to us!!  overall food flavor a solid 3.5 - bbq was good, but not the best ;)

nmXBbCOosjKYEZaJW3IOtw.text: I went there last weekend with my family. My wife and kids got a half chicken with sweet mash potato. I got pulled chicken with fries. We got our food in a timely manner. The staff was great and polite.  We had to try their desert I got the banana pudding and my wife and kids got the s'mores.  It was great experience for my entire family.  I would recommend it to people.

cAA_IvwxAYEhUk-4hHHzCA.text: Satisfyingly delicious! First time trying out this place for dinner. I had my order delivered through grubhub & couldn't be more satisfied. Order came in early & it was easy to place! I got the baby back ribs combo with mashed potatoes, mac n cheese, with toast. I also added a side of brisket, and their house sauce. Which is so tasty! The meat was tender on both & the brisket was to die for! Would definitely eat from here again!

3mZjxxSIbxUNqHpo0akEjw.text: Bar-B-Que, there's not much to it. Not too hard to get wrong as long as you offer up some burn animal flesh and delicious sides. I've driven by Bell's BBQ a number of times and I never went in until recently. We made a point to go to Bell's and all in all it wasn't a bad experience. Can't really say I'm a fan and not really sure I'd go back, but it's an option if you're in the area seeing as there aren't too many other BBQ joints around. However I did like Big B's Texas BBQ on St Rose better.  On to the review:  The place is pretty easy to find and parking was a breeze. We went during lunch time on a Saturday afternoon. The place wasn't too busy and we were able to order right away. Table Service was good.  Here's what we got and what we thought: Baby Back Ribs - These were okay. I've had better. The meat wasn't as tender and the meat quantity was a little light on the bones. Those pigs were probably undernourished? 3-Cheese Mac - This was pretty tasty. The cheese was melty (is that a word?) and macaroni was good. Get this as a side unless you're lactose intolerant. Pulled Pork Sandwich - This was okay. Pull pork was tender, but nothing outstanding in the flavor department. It came stuffed in this big loaf of bread and the bread to pork ratio was unfortunately biased to the bread. Crispy Brussels Sprouts - meh. They were crispy, but not all that great. 4-Cheese Crusted Corn - This was a nice idea on paper, but the cheese flakes off the corn pretty quickly, so your first bite has cheese and corn and next bite is all corn because the cheese has likely fallen off. Chopped Brisket - This wasn't bad. As part of the kids meal this is a good choice. Pulled Chicken - A bit dry. Nothing special. Garlic Smashed Potatoes - This was good. Devyn's Homemade Pickles - Nothing special here. You get some slices included with your meal. Meh.  Also with all this you can try a number of different BBQ sauces including: House, Mustard, Spicy, Nashville, Old Fashioned, Gluten Free.  Here's what we thought since we tried them all.  House = Old Fashioned = Gluten Free = all taste very similar Spicy - wasn't very spicy and close in flavor to the House Nashville - Was more tangy. Mustard - a mix of House BBQ and some sweetness of Honey Mustard I would say Bell's BBQ could probably just have 4 flavors: House, Spicy (make it more spicy), Nashville, and Mustard. The others are just taking up space. But even then all the sauces weren't outstanding. We mainly stuck with Nashville and Mustard.  Anyhow, if you looking for really great BBQ I don't think Bell's is the place.  You'd have to drive out to California and get Smoking Ribs or Phil's down in San Diego, but seeing as they're not local, I'd go Big B's Texas BBQ.

photos.caption: Photo of Bell's BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. Baby back ribs with crusted cheese corn and crispy brussel sprouts. Cheese comes off corn in one bite and sprouts are okay.
Photo of Bell's BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. Baby Back Ribs with 3-cheese mac, garlic smashed potatoes. Them bones need more meat. Potatoes were good. Devyn&#39;s homemade pickles - meh.
Photo of Bell's BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. Pull Pork Sandwich - pork to bread ratio was off. Way too much bread.

g-CRL3t2Q34hhbso8EUYQQ.text: Absolutely phenomenal. I guess I had no idea what properly made BBQ tasted like until I went to Bell's The meat seems to melt in your mouth. What a hidden gem this place was. I am rarely in the area and this place will be a reason to go back. Spoke to the owner hes a wonderful guy the whole staff is amazing. I highly recommend you stop by if you're in the area you wont regret it.

rnCL1Ijhdcj8thCHoZAnEg.text: The lady at the front was very pleasant. I ordered fried Catfish, shrimp, okra, potato salad, red beans and rice, baked beans,  yams, cornbread and corn on the cob. hLd24f77vksYrsHgH6Q8pQ.text: My fave go-to BBQ! The brisket sandwich and Mac n' cheese is delish and I always take half of it home because it's so much good. Really great service every time!

ptD0IHTNXTvFQpXflWymMg.text: Drove by several time going home. Stopped in for lunch. Nice interior, not fancy but comfortable with an extensive look up menu board. The server, Ava was welcoming and helpful. The food was excellent, 5pc St. Louis Ribs, with two sides. I had Mac n Cheese and coleslaw. The Mac was over the top, one of the best I have had. They offer several sauces, the presentation was nice with crispy thin fried onions and pickles. The onions were a great compliment and very tasty. Will definitely visit again, just for the Mac n Cheese. Forgot to mention the ribs were delicious and fell off the bone.

MA3Qxr9P920lUWA4_07K_A.text: It's nice to have such a great family-owned & operated restaurant to close to home!  We've done Uber eats with Bell's but never went in to eat until this week! I remembered seeing something about Kids eating free on Tuesday so...  We got a free meal for my kiddo (chicken tenders) since my husband had an entree (the shrimp po' boy) while I ate all of the sides! My favorites are the black eyed peas, collard greens, cornbread, side salad, and OKRA FRIES! Sometimes we've gone to order them on Uber eats and they're sold out!  They're full-length pieces of okra and perfectly breaded and fried with cornmeal. My little one eats them like a fiend! I'm flexatarian, so I make some wiggle room in my mostly-vegan diet for Bell's!  There's a good beer selection as well as tons of options for the kids. The staff is super friendly and accommodating. We were just talking about making this our Tuesday night gig!

V2JuD0sac0alGuJktIXrRA.text: The fried okra is like no other...amazing! The pork belly and cheese grits are delicious!

XL96E2Lck65G2ZLSt1w-Cg.text: I have passed this place 100's of times and finally stopped in and had a Awesome Meal!  It was So Delicious, Tasty, and Filling!  Yum :)  Of course I had Ribs, Baked Beans, Toast, OMG  - I ate way to much!  The Dinner was brought out to the table in a very timely manner, hot food, 5 ribs is way enough and filling!  The baked Beans were probably some of the best I've tasted, OMG,  So Good!  The ambiance was proper, restaurant was clean, and the staff was very professional!  The pricing very reasonable!  Time to go to the gym!  Burn Those Calories Off!  A must go for all, "Family, Friends, Co-Workers, and Even a Hot Date"  Love is in the air at Bell's BBQ  God Speed!  Jake Out For Now!

vX8wdfYgOseGbIqPYTYjJQ.text: Great family environment. Customer service is excellent. Good tunes and darn good food!

UnmLVThBgd0p1_iOtJd06A.text: I wouldn't even call this place BBQ. I doubt they even own a smoker. Maybe a couple of big crockpots. Sides tasted like lunchroom food. Ribs were very dry. It tasted like grandmas roast beef and not grandma in her prime; more like grandma is forgetful and leaves the roast beef in the crockpot for about a week. Disgraceful to BBQ.

eQKC_2PtgGR04VkacpKliw.text: This is my favorite BBQ place in Henderson! All the meats are amazing and there are so many sides to choose from. Mashed yams are my favorite. The cornbread is a touch sweet and perfect. The staff are kind and remember us when we come in.

Everyone is so sweet, they checked on me often, great suggestions, size is huge but I couldn't stop eating especially with the spicy bbq sauce. Wow just wow. fMCTdCK9Wmxh49GZ-pw5_Q.text: I got jipped....Let me explain.   So I saw these on the menu, it had been on my mind for about a week.   So I decided I wanted to try something different.   I ordered the Crispy Chicken Nachos.  I realized it had the cheese sauce, ok I wasn't too crazy about that, but I had already put my order in.  no worries.  So I got my order, and they gave me a fork with it.   It had the cheese sauce, tomatoes, pickled jalapeno's sour cream and green onions.   All great ingredients!  But I never would have put them together!  My first bite......LAWDDDDDDD HAV MERCY! I never would have thought this would have taste like this, it was amazing, The chicken was amazing, and crispy!  I'm not that person that sucks the chicken wing to the bone, but I was trying to scoop up all the sauce and all the other goodies, that fell to the bottom of the container.   If I could have licked the container I would have.   I got jipped because they should have given me a spoon not a fork.   customer service was great, I plan on going back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Bell's BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. Crispy chicken nachos,  no chorizo.

jETeO4UEod4Wx4UjoKdXCw.text: Stellar restaurant! Go here, eat things, you wont be sad that you did.   My husband is from Texas and he misses good BBQ, and when we walked into this restaurant he felt right at home. It smelled amazing, and turned out to be really really delish food. The food is quality, and with quality comes the cost associated with good food. This place is not cheap, but its also not super expensive either.   The sides are epic, especially the 4 cheese corn and the brussel sprouts. Sides come with sandwiches, and 2 sides with dinner plates. I ordered the shrimp po' boy, which was amazeballs, with the 4 cheese corn and the garlic mashers. The husband ordered the chicken plate, with the cauliflower and brussels. And together we shared the cheesecake served in a jar, super fun and ridiculously amazing as it wasn't overly rich or sweet but hit the spot! We both were overstuffed after eating our meals, and we took home leftovers. In all honesty we could have shared the sandwich, sides, and the dessert and left stuffed without leftovers.   This is a family run business and you can tell, they care about what they serve to their customers and it shows in the quality and taste of their food. GO HERE! EAT THINGS!

vNccNS5VquwgemK5lqKslg.text: I was in desperate need to find a spot that makes black eyed peas like what I just experienced while down south. I'm also a fan of potato salad and love me some deviled eggs, so I thought this was the spot for me. I ordered the fried catfish dinner with the potato salad and b.e.p's... Well, I'm sorry to say the sides were disappointing. The black eyed peas were on the hard side, like they weren't allowed to soak long enough. No amount of hot sauce can fix hard beans. The potato salad had very large chunks of potatoes that were also too hard, I couldn't believe it... The catfish w/bbq tarter sauce on the other hand was outstanding!... I still can't help but feel sad that I literally paid $20 and only ate the catfish because the sides weren't cooked thoroughly, I had to toss them out unfortunately. On a positive note, the restaurant is clean and has good vibes and the gentleman at the register was pleasant.

photos.caption: Photo of Bell's BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. Catfish is amazing

vbYyW5s2ov84T8cqGhWUQw.text: Soooooo good!!! Amazing customer service! This is the best BBQ we have eaten. You must come here!

CQv24-uC9oU-OqB3LxfVmw.text: Just had Bell's for dinner with my wife & my in laws, & everyone raved about their food. I had the pork belly with a side of red beans and rice & Mac & cheese.  My father in law & I shared a side of fried cat fish. We also tried the cornbread (which they said was the best they'd ever had & compared it to pound cake).  Wife had shrimp & grits & all I can say is we might have found our 4th of July bbq provider.

0Z3VsZWgCxspPTo_9QVC_A.text: Had dinner here last night. All of us ordered something different and all were very pleased with the main courses: catfish (excellent!), ribs (tender, juicy and not fatty), chicken tenders & shrimp po-boy. Large portions and great taste! Side dishes were good but they were out of the okra fries which was one of the main reasons I wanted to go here. I ordered fried green tomatoes instead and they were horrible! The breading was way too thick and doughy, not crispy at all, and they were cold. If they had been good, I would have been upset that there were only 3! I did tell one of the employees (nicely) and was told "I'll tell the cook." No offer to reduce the bill or get a different side dish, dessert, etc. Not a deal breaker but would have been a nice gesture. Other sides ordered were pretty good - 5x fries, yams, coleslaw, potato salad, corn on the cob and salad. The bbq sauces were very vinegary and I didn't care for them but that is just my personal opinion and others may like them. Desserts were very good and the mini mason jars are a nice touch. My overall opinion is that the food for the most part is very good however, I felt it was quite pricey for not being a "sit down and order" place. One more thing - there is a small container for trash on the counter near the drink station - a bit of a turn off but at least it only contained straw wrappers and a few squeezed lemon wedges! May go again but order differently to try to save some $$.

q9yIzhom0HvqeN3WL6425A.text: Recently ate at Bell's BBQ.  Was super excited to try it since it is in the neighborhood.  The people were friendly and helpful.  At dinner they had run out of brisket, and it wasn't very late.  The staff was friendly.  They recommended the corn as a side, and the young lady behind the desk said it was delicious.  It tasted like it had either been frozen or boiled in water so long it was mushy.  The chicken and the pulled pork were ok but nothing you would want to come back and have a second time.  To be fair though, my husband has a smoker in the backyard and smokes his own brisket, pork and chicken.  We thought we would try some so we wouldn't have to cook it ourselves, but Bell's won't be replacing home bbq.

MsPChvzDZnhTWwT7znTcyA.text: The pulled pork sandwich is put in a Texas type toast which is wonderful. The bread is very tasty and the   deserts are also great.  I will be back to eat at Bells it is wonderful to have a 5a bbq place near me. Go there the food is wonderful you won't be disappointed.

My wife and I had 4 different meats (try the pork belly), 4 different sides, and 2 deserts.  Bells has an amazing atmosphere and the staff is beyond friendly.  With the great attitude of the staff and bbq to die for, check this place out.  A must for locals and even tourists who come in.

17FM9dOk_-acnks5H8svHg.text: Better than Lucilles.  Friendly staff and nice calm quiet atmosphere.  Food is served with pride and mastery!

bcairnpWdaPoeWOEDLk5Mw.text: This is by far the best barbecue in Las Vegas!  The baby back ribs are amazing - the BBQ sauce is the best.  The okra fries shouldn't be missed - great baked beans.  The mac and cheese was a miss for us, but everything else was wonderful.  Great job Bell's BBQ!

0retFglh7Dinv8TRY1jj1A.text: I got take out for the family because one of my friends said they loved the food.  We ordered the BBQ chicken, BBQ brisket and the BBQ pork.  All were very tasty! It took awhile to get our food but were told with apologies that they just had a large take out order that backed them up. Food is 5 stars. Had both the pork and chicken and both were succulent and tasty. The sides of mac and cheese and mashed potatoes i tried were good as well. Wish i didnt get it togo as i think that might have  spoiled some of the fresh from the oven goodness. I will definitely be back.

My husband ordered the brisket sandwich with onion straws.  He loves his onion straws.  He said the bread was really good too but holy cow it's a huge slice of bread!  My pulled pork was pretty dry, smashed potatoes were bland and my okra was so do.  I was intrigued by the okra fries but they are difficult to bite so you have to shove the whole thing in your mouth.  I like it cut up better.  They have three sauces, spicy, old fashioned and house.  I preferred the house, it tasted like a vinegar base.  My husband liked his brisket but said it's a little too dry but he enjoyed the sauce.

Ni88olaezmFJiEQk4lgmIQ.text: The ribs were really good I like the baby back's more then the beef ribs they were more tender I thought the barbecue sauce was excellent the corn on the cob was a little disappointing he was like maybe not ready to be picked and cooked and eaten it was very thin didn't get much out of it, but everything else was good dessert was good and I have to give it four stars.

gkO953Ph0PM_0ssLFJ8HgA.text: I have been in here a few times. My last time Feb 19th, I got the sliced brisket. Five stars on that for sure! I read the review Sheryl S left......I think it is a fake review......never trust a Yelp review that has only two reviews and they are 5 years apart!..... I will continue to come to this BBQ place until they give me a reason not too.  The tater tot thingys were real good too as was the spicy BBQ sauce.......Keep it up Bell's!

pl8w0XySxMj-uQhAWtTXkw.text: I could eat BBQ any day, and I had heard good things about Bell's and decided to give it a try.   The first time I went was at 8:30 on a Thursday. They were open until 9, but the doors were already closed. No big issue - it may have been a slow night and they closed early?  Next time they were open, and we got the Brussel Sprouts, Macaroni and Cheese, Coleslaw and ribs. The Brussel Sprouts were fantastic! Crunchy and delicious! My son loved and Mac and Cheese, especially with the Ritz Cracker crust. The coleslaw was fine, nothing wild, but it is just coleslaw ;-) The meat, the star of the show, was lackluster. There was so much fat and very little meat. I know BBQ, especially ribs, can be fatty, but this way way too much. I took my first bite and it was all fat. I just can't give this place 4+ stars when the BBQ itself is not as good tasting as some of the sides.   Two friends of mine went the other week and said the same thing - sides and dessert were good, but the meat was lacking in the flavor department.   Maybe we'll go back one day as I heard they have several gluten free options, but unfortunately, I am in no rush.

rgqnzB3bCvoDuzaZw63Z5Q.text: Randomly was in the mood for catfish, ribs & Mac n cheese. So I decided to order for delivery! omg...it was so good. Love the house BBQ sauce! I'm a sucker for Mac n cheese & I definitely fell in love, next time I'm ordering a pint for just myself. Hahahah.   I think this is probably the best catfish I've had so far! Well besides Mario's on MLK. I wasn't really a fan of the devils egg potato salad, it could use some more flavor! Over all, my food was so delicious & no complaints about the main entrees. I'll definitely eat here again and again.

J-ivRwzrBmhcqqPfIG3CXQ.text: What an awesome place for authentic bbq!  Owner is so friendly and the food was outstanding!  Love the "huge" beef rib!!! OMG- corn??? The best!   Love their desserts, called sweet jars!  Red velvet was my favorite This is our new favorite for bbq!

Photo of Bell's BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. That&#39;s a beef rib!! Huge!

ND_EcgofbS-yC89vi-Xz1w.text: Got the brisket......very good.......and some ribs.....good.....and potato salad......decent......and mashed potatoes......decent.....and chicken fingers....very good (though there were only 2 when they delivered it and the menu said 3).

ntqvCxQvpru115vkytZ2cA.text: I'm always looking for good BBQ Beef Ribs and Bell's definitely has them! They tend to run out so it is good to call ahead to make sure they have some.   The Beef rims were not too smokey and for me that is a good thing. Sometimes I taste more of the smoke than the flavor of the meat and what it has been seasoned with or marinated in. The beef ribs were juicy and on point!  I do look forward to coming back and trying more of what is on the menu cause a lot of the items looked and smelled delicious!

kwbffcZkVnqJ-TQIiwLACw.text: Found this awesome place as I was driving around the area one day, and decided to take my coworkers with me to try it out during lunch. Probably as close as you can get to good southern food. Pulled Chicken is great, and the corn and Brussels sprouts were amazing... Price is reasonable and parking is easy.. The cashier was very knowledgeable and very friendly.. They did take a while to cook the food though, so maybe calling in an order or expect to wait a little. Definitely coming back !

photos.caption: Photo of Bell's BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. Pulled Chicken, Crispy Brussel Sprouts, Crusted Corn

vzJrxqkBwNHmn0PLWo93uw.text: The wait was more than 1 1/2 hours.  The kitchen and staff were busy to the point when you spoke to them the reaction was border line rude. The store had been working on so many deliveries that they couldn't keep up.! Hire more staff before you take on business you can't handle !

tG0EskuhxYAS2rcYC2b1WA.text: Well done. I don't think there could be any better words to describe this awesome food. I fully recommend this to anyone that wants really good bbq. PS try the Creme Brulee it will knock your socks off

KUkZlnXqwPqBqTfP6AVxxQ.text: Grabbed take out from here over the weekend and really loved it. I had the shrimp po boy with kale salad which was super yummy and the s' more pudding which actually came in a glass jar even though it was take out. My only criticism was the po boy used too much bread so I ended up dumping out the insides and eating them with a fork. Hubby got the Mac and cheese and banana pudding and he loved both!

1hggyOL0hrl6OvCD0NDpLw.text: This place is a go to for my family. St. Louis ribs are bomb. Fried shrimp plate is great.  Hot links have a little kick to them. All and all a solid place.   Most of the sides are awesome. Cornbread is some of the best I've had. Four cheese corn on the cob is fantastic. My wife loves the krunch salad. The Mac and cheese is also legit.   They have sweet jars for desert that will amaze you. It's a big mouth mason jar filled with goodness.

lzFRAWKHCDVj9CbWG6yMsQ.text: Late post. I came here last month when my mother in law came into town. She's from NC and I am from AL. So we bother have different views on BBQ. Well this place was a hit with us. First when we walked in, I felt like I was back in the South with the hospitality from the staff. We explained we just moved here and this was our first time in. They explained the menu and told us how they make the meats. The sandwiches were very delicious! A++ will return soon.

TjnIsPz7Wf2mRBVRjyeXTQ.text: OMG I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!! I eat here so much that my hubby told me I had to stop because I couldn't spend $200 on bbq in a month lmao. this place is legit and I love it, I had to cut back on eating here but still love it!!!! everyone is so nice and they take the time to talk to you and remember you and what you like, its a great place!!!

uBcpWd2zzWt4zDymyvfZeA.text: Best BBQ in Nevada!!! I ordered a party platter and was definitely awesome! By the way fried shrimp and chicken wings are phenomenal(pro tip)

CStjIan2LZ9Sg1nPGoxnTw.text: It was our first time and I was having a difficult time deciding what to order. It must have shown on my face because the woman at the register (I'm sorry I don't recall her name) started to explain the choices of the different meats in sandwiches or combos and all the different sides. I ordered the babyback ribs as a combo so that included 2 sides. The ribs sit on Texas toast and came with hard boild egg potato salad plus a side salad. It was a lot of food. And it was all delicious! We even got pie as a to go order.  We will definitely be going back.  We got there for a late lunch/early dinner and it was pretty quiet but as we were leaving there was quite the line forming. My tip if you plan on going for dinner plan on waiting in line. The food is worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Bell's BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. Babyback ribs, potato salad and side salad

Y82BBKgk7aM21YWlFKL6kg.text: I've been a loyal customer of this place for the last six months or so. It's so good that I just moved to Summerlin and now drive across town to get my fix every two weeks. When I'm there I dine in and get two orders to go. It's the best bbq I've ever had. Eric the owner has a great rapport with his customers and is very accommodating. The crew he has working there are also great. They're always quick to get me a refill on my soda, etc.  I'm sure Eric's tired of me bugging him about opening a Summerlin location but too bad, Eric...I'm gonna keep harassing you (just kidding). No, in all seriousness, this place gets enough steady business that I doubt he even needs a second location.

4oBq7a0P-oUXKwSrZ1YMTA.text: We've been to Bell's BBQ, it has been a wonderful experience each time.  When you walk in, you order from the counter. Then find a table, most people enjoy getting one of the many booths that line the parameter of the restaurant. Your food is brought to your table and they continue to check on your table if you need anything else throughout the course of your meal. Service is wonderful, always with a smile and all the staff we have met so far have been very nice.   What I recommend: -Chopped brisket sandwich.  -The half smoked chicken.  -The side of Kale Salad.  -The side of Mashed yams (oh soooo delicious).  -The Mac and Cheese for kids. (Huge! You can split with between 2 kids) -The side of fries (it comes with every kind of fry! Regular, curly, waffle, sweet potato, crinkle, my daughter loved it) --And the Shrimp and Grits   The Shrimp and Grits are in my picture and I posted a video too..  get ready to drool when you watch the video. Tommy makes it the best! I love this dish, it's my new favorite craving! In my opinion, by far the best thing on the menu.   They have desserts, called sweet jars. We have yet to try one yet as we have been too full. Maybe we will make a trip here just for dessert.   One more note, my son just turned one and when I place him in the highchair, the table is the perfect height for him to enjoy and eat with us. Sometimes, other restaurants do not take this into consideration, and the table ends up being up to the toddlers nose. In this case, the height is perfect and is a BIG plus because it makes takes my kids here to eat very easy.   Tuesday's kids eat free. That's a bonus! Will be back for that too.   Bell's BBQ is quickly becoming a family favorite that we will frequent in the years to come.

4PgxSrgLjVrUcH4CJRmXYA.text: Food is amazing. We were traveling from the Grand Canyon back to Vegas. Yelp to the rescue for something different. We came upon this place. Wow the brisket is to die for! You will not be sorry you ordered it! Pulled pork was very good too. Potato salad was a bit spicy but the owner switched it out no problems! They will let you sample the sides and I would do that with it and the slaw. Grits-cheese and mac n cheese was beyond delicious! Corn bread as others mentioned is ..well... it is the best I have had in a very long time! It is sweet and moist! Love the outdoor seating for a mild night like we had. My only regret is we do not have one in Indianapolis!

C15ahKBfTArq2DYGWDhByw.text: Barbeque, ordered via takeout, so good I wish I could give this place five stars.  As a disclaimer, I lack the refined pallette of some of my friends when it comes to barbecue. I'm horribly inept at identifying the "smokiness of the rub" or judging the "nuttiness of the sauce."   But I can tell you that every corner of the menu here is slathered in dazzlingly fresh ingredients, with a splash of unique flair in every dish.  The pulled chicken sandwich is crammed into the middle of a single buttery, griddled loaf of Texas style toast, overflowing with mouthwatering strands of chicken ready to be drenched (to your own preference) in a side cup of barbecue sauce.  The fries are an adventure in themselves, with an assortment of sweet, salty, thick, and impossibly skinny fried potatoes. The mac and cheese is perfectly creamy, slathered with a delightful variety of sharp and mild cheeses. The braised greens are juicy and fresh, an exquisitely mild and faintly bitter foil to your feast of riches. And the beans are a meal into themselves, the full spectrum of beans comingled in a deliciously flavorful sauce with a huge lump of pulled pork(?).  Oh, and the dessert! A delicious banana pudding, with slices of real carmelized bananas. All of it served in a surprisingly beautiful and sturdy jar I'm finding hard to throw away.  The service was plenty friendly when I arrived, but painfully slow - he seemed far overstretched for what appeared to be only a few orders coming in.  Could've been just an off day, but I waited a solid 15 minutes after the initial time it was supposed to be ready (20 minutes after order was placed). For barbecue this good, I'm perfectly okay with waiting a little longer for it to be ready. Just let me know!

photos.caption: Photo of Bell's BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. Pulled Chicken Sandwich with  Fries
Photo of Bell's BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. Caramelized Banana Pudding
Photo of Bell's BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. BBQ Beans x5

TjKfoY7Kekdd1ulEJTefpw.text: First thing I noticed when I walked in was how clean and spacious the place was.  What stood out on the menu was the pork belly.  Not an item I see at any other BBQ joints around town, I had to try it.  I always get a beef rib whenever I find them.  There are a ton of sides to choose from, I went with the deviled egg potato salad and red beans and rice.  The Good: Pork belly was amazing!!!  Thick cut pork belly smoked then cut into chunks and tossed in the deep fryer!!  You end up with a crispy, smokey, unique taste that you won't find anywhere else.  A 5 star dish for sure!!  The Okay: Beef rib and red beans and rice were ok.  I'd say these dishes are 3.5 stars.    The Bad: Deviled egg potato salad was gross.  It did not taste like deviled eggs, there was no egg in it, and it was very bland.  My coworker and I both ordered it and both agreed that it was horrible.  1 star dish.  Overall, the pork belly was the star.  My coworkers food looked delicious and they said it was good.  Portions are large and worth the money.  I would go back and try some of the other meats and sides.

photos.caption: Photo of Bell's BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. Pork belly + beef rib + deviled eggs potato salad + red beans &amp; rice
Photo of Bell's BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. Okra fries
Photo of Bell's BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. Pulled rib meat sandwich + friend Brussels sprouts

diR1C10l1jeDvr1ign3QTw.text: During my first visit, the meats I tried were the brisket, (which was flavorful) and pulled chicken (seemed a little dry, but I think because it's shredded, that probably dries it out some). I also tried the crispy brussel sprouts that were really yummy and the crispyness took away the bitter taste that I normally find with brussel sprouts. The deviled egg potato salad was good and had a little kick to it; the potato pieces were a little large and I did have to cut them. The bbq beans were great and included some shredded meat (I think pork) and tasted great; they also had a little spice. In my opinion, the sauces tasted best when they marinated on the meat for a few minutes. The regular bbq sauce combined with the spicy bbq sauce balanced each other out and gave a little heat, but not too much. Great service and the restaurant was clean and food tasted fresh.

tb7hyxE0U4UkijxDHHeSUg.text: This place offers good BBQ at a reasonable price. The environment is casual, and the service is really exceptional.   I would give it five stars, but it isn't the best I've ever had.  I will be back!

clOveddboNA2IDDLzaYLFg.text: They have super good BBQ chicken! It comes topped with fried onion strings which are one of my favorite things ever invented. There's a spacious dining area with plenty of seating. I was impressed with the amount of sides you can choose from on the menu. It's super diverse. The mac and cheese is wonderful. It's creamy and thick. I was less impressed with the cole slaw. I've absolutely never had pickles diced into my coleslaw but it is NOT my thing. It's overpowering and isn't the classic taste of coleslaw I was expecting. Our server was really nice and I was too shy to tell her I didn't like it. The price is fair for the large amount of food you get here. Each plate comes with some yummy texas toast as well.

YvKkvi7Q7JXJzQluhhND1g.text: Popped into Bell's BBQ on a slow Sunday evening. I ordered the Smoked Chicken, with two sides, Collard Greens and the Buffalo Cauliflower. All of the food was delicious, and you receive a good portion for what you pay. Would definitely suggest Bells BBQ if you're in the area, and are craving BBQ.

wUsFgdz0VhHXi9_At4EsvA.text: It's a nice place for some bbq. Went inside with some friends and we ordered the brisket sandwich with zucchini fries. The sandwich was what I expected but what really got me was the cornbread. It was the best cornbread I ever tasted in Las Vegas. All that for less than $15 and it was fulfilling. Customer service was nice and friendly. Parking is located outside also if you want to eat outside there is benches to do so.

0Yj3Y5gL1KhoN1PC8NUuFQ.text: Great BBQ with many delicious sides to choose from! The Brisket and Pulled Pork were terrific and the mac&cheese well ...the cheesiest!!! Great beers to drink while the prepare your meal....I picked two deserts as well but haven't had the chance yet to enjoy! Can't wait to come back and try the ribs!!!

IeoDuHkPG93ll0n1r2Q_DQ.text: Bell's BBQ gives all BBQ places in the valley a run for their money!  Everything is fresh, staff is super helpful and friendly, and nothing is lacking flavour.  I ended up choosing Cameron's Southern Fried Chicken Breast Strips (about $16 with tax) since I didn't want to get my hands all messy during my lunch break.  It comes with 2 sides, a large slice of Texas toast, and 2 pickle slices.  Literally 2.  The chicken strips were large and had little to no fat on them.  Fried to perfection.  No hints of old, overused grease whatsoever.  I chose mashed potatoes and macaroni for my 2 sides.  Again, no complaints this way.  The macaroni was creamy and the potatoes were the ideal texture with just a hint of garlic.  Not overbearing but just right.  According to their website, all sides are homemade and I am not going to disagree with that.  Only thing I would change is the serving of 2 quarter sized pickles.  The pickles are very good, but I wish they gave you more lol I don't really understand the point of adding pickles if they aren't a regular amount.  It's not like I ordered a sandwich.  Definitely delicious, and a place I would never say no to!

photos.caption: Photo of Bell's BBQ - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken strips with Macaroni and Garlic Smashed potatoes

GbWXfN93je1Scm0ETjRP3A.text: Look what I found in a strip mall. I was greeted with a smile. The restaurant was clean and the food and service was fantastic. I enjoyed the  brisket. It was crazy tender with the perfect amount if smokey goodness. The baked beans were thick and the three mac and cheese was the bomb.

i52xUS46kxAc9JSwkx20YA.text: I had an amazing experience with my bestie!! One of the best BBQ restaurant I had ever been. Love the welcome they give you when you walk in, they are very helpful if is your first time they will go over the menu and will explain how can you choose your meal. I really enjoy eating my lunch there specially with the atmosphere of the place. They have music on tables are ready for you to pick and they also have a nice and relaxing waiting area for you to wait for your pick up or for to wait for a table to be available. The meal portion are huge so if you don't eat it at ones just ask for a take out box. I can't wait again to plan another visit and try another adventure meal from Bells BBQ!!!!

iyQd2U6hY0TNLp2uVGPEdQ.text: Went in for lunch the other day. I have been here before for dinner and it was good, so decided hey, why not. We were greeted right when we walked in. There was no line, which is always nice.  My sister in law just moved here, and had never been here. She wanted to try tri-tip, as that is her favorite thing ever. To her dismay, they do not serve tri-tip.  Not yet anyway. The gentleman that rang us up said they were considering it somewhere down the line. She ordered the brisket sandwich, and I ordered the pulled chicken sandwich with deviled egg potato salad.  The pulled chicken is very good. I tried their original sauce on it as well, very tasty. The bread is a little overwhelming, however. It is Texas toast, which I love, but it is a little too much using a very thick slice for a sandwich. They make a slit down the middle and stuff it with the meat. It was very good, don't get me wrong, Just way too much bread.  The potato salad is really good. I have had it before, and wanted it again. The gentleman that rang us up indicated it was spicy- I didn't think so at all.   Service is good, the place is super cute and clean. It's also close to our home, so easy to get to!

YlvSaoymCFHsAvMDwllpkw.text: I can't say enough good things about this place from my first visit.   The service:  As soon as we walked in, we were greeted. The cashier, the servers, the cooks, all so nice as we ordered and got served. Very friendly! I wish I had more cash to tip them after paying for our meal!   The food: Very flavorful and there's an extensive side dishes menu. My favorites were the brisket entree and pork belly entree, with sides of collard green, Brussel Sprouts, and deviled egg potato salad. My cousin says the cheese crusted corn was amazing also-which it looked delicious! (We also got the Mac n cheese which was good! Next time I want okra fries!) I wouldn't say it's the BEST brisket I've had in terms of tenderness, but still worth th price and the flavors were spot on!  Deserts were also just as delicious! The "sweet jars" were the perfect ending to an umami tasting meal. Not too large, but enough for two people to share very well , or one person to indulge fully. (My favs are the banana pudding & key lime...and s'mores if you like chocolate!)  Drinks: They have a self serve fountain station as well as sweet tea. If you don't like those, they also have a selection of beer that you can chose from! Just show your ID!   Pricing: We did the entree which was about $14-15. It includes two sides of your choice and the meat selected. (We did one brisket and then ordered another with pork belly). I believe the drink is separate and was about $2-$3? I'm unsure actually. The dessert sweet jars were around $6.50 or $7. It's a bit pricier of a full meal, but you definitely get a good amounts worth!! We took a lot home!   Tip #1: BE SURE TO CHECK IN. We forgot to check in right when we got there and they have $5 off your order of $25 or more.  Tip#2: try the sauces on the table! My favorite one was the spicy bbq and the mustard bbq!

7qZ3Xw8B9dqivwWYHdGsFQ.text: The fiance was craving BBQ ... good ol Yelp helped us find Bell's BBQ.     We literally wanted to try everything and we were definitely what I call "ordering with our eyes" so we ended up getting a togo box.  I've read reviews that complained about the prices, but I've been to several BBQ places and the price is reasonable and comparable to others.  I mean you can't expect to get half a rack of ribs for 5 bucks.  C'mon people !   Overall it satisfied our craving for BBQ.

IZnA8HKaj8wtm85lxQurdQ.text: We are always on the search for good bbq. As most of you know it can be a very hard thing to do. And those of you who read my reviews know that I am extremely picky when it comes to meat!  We decided to give Bell's BBQ a try after reading the reviews and looking at everyone's yummy photos! We have two BBQ places we frequent regularly and I have to say....Bell's has beaten them all!  :) Not only with the food, but the service and the atmosphere and the prices!!!! A huge win win all around!!!! All together we had: brisket, pulled pork, spare ribs, mac-n-cheese, buffalo cauliflower, coleslaw and 4 cheese crusted corn on the cob!!!! Spare ribs were out of this world...didn't even need a drop of sauce.. incredible...flavorful...fell off the bone! I put some of the pulled pork on my mac-n-cheese and omg...mmmmmm! For me my favorite part was the buffalo cauliflower....I would go back for that alone!!!! Incredible! But honestly everything was delicious and we have found out new go to BBQ joint for sure!!!!  We were told we should save room for dessert so we did...we had ordered the banana pudding and creme brulee but they were out of banana pudding...so we had 2 creme brulee....so creamy and had a faint taste of vanilla...but the perfect amount of sugar on the top.  Definitely hoping they have banana next time so we can try that...but would definitely get the creme brulee again. The atmosphere was great, clean fun staff and great music playing!!  The person who took our order asked us if it was our 1st time there and was very helpful with suggestions!  Thank you for a great experience all around and we will be seeing you soon!!!

u3mHSGTXhxBbVMQ_NUa6Vw.text: I wanted to update my review and add another star. My subsequent visits to Bell's have been far more positive than our initial visit. They've still been out of items (like beef ribs) on a couple trips, but they generally have what we order.    I absolutely love the buffalo cauliflower and the brussel sprouts (both are up-charges as meal sides)  Also, their sauces are better than they were when they first opened.  If you order dessert for takeout, don't forget to return your mason jars to get entered into a $20 gift certificate each month.  Lastly, it's nice that kids eat free on Tuesdays.
